channel.title: Instantiating classes
channel.description:
I know how to instantiate a class in the regular ways (SomeHandler handler = new SomeHandler();) like that
But i have seen a few people instantiate new classes from within a method like
doSomething(new SomeHandler()) I was wondering how that would work? I tried searching for a tut but could only find the regular instantiation and nested classes. Say for an int it would be doSomething(int (name)). Would i have to do doSomething(Object (name)) to instantiate the class?
Please, i kind of want to learn this, would make a project im working on loads easier.

item.title: Instantiating classes
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

ill pk ur as:

client.java lul

You sir are a dumbass, learn to read.

EDIT: nvm im just going to use the toString() method and i did find out to instantiate a class from a method i have to use Object obj or w/e.

Read full topic
